data.title: Engil consortium applies for new airport concession
data.text:
Luanda, July 12, 2024 (Lusa) - The consortium comprising Corporacion América Aeroports, Mota-Engil and Best Fly is one of those acknowledged in the tender for the concession of Dr António Agostinho Neto International Airport (AIAAN), which should be fully operational by the end of the year.

According to a statement from the Angolan Ministry of Transport, the other proposal acknowledged in the tender to operate Luanda's new airport is a consortium made up of China National Aero-Technology International Engineering Corporation (CAIEC) and Yunnan Airport Group Co., Ltd.

The public tender, launched on 17 November, provides for the concession of the right to operate, manage and maintain AIAAN for a period of 25 years, with the possibility of extending it for a further 15 years.

The new airport has the capacity to handle up to 15 million passengers and 130,000 tonnes of goods a year, and currently only receives cargo flights.

In the last quarter of 2024, according to the Ministry's statement, it is expected to be fully operational with commercial flights (domestic, regional and international).

"These proposals will be subjected to a detailed evaluation process, followed by a negotiation phase, with a view to improving the acknowledged proposals. Only after these stages have been completed will the contracting public entity take the final award decision," the government body emphasises.

Corporacion América Airports (CAAP) specialises in airport management and currently operates 52 airports in six Latin American and European countries (Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay, Ecuador, Armenia and Italy), making it the tenth largest private sector airport operator in the world.

Mota-Engil, of Portuguese origin but currently controlled by China, is a company specialising in the construction and infrastructure management sector, with a consolidated position among the 30 largest European construction companies, holdings in more than 200 companies, and a presence in more than 30 countries in Europe, Africa and Latin America.

Best Fly Angola, Lda, is an Angolan aviation company founded in November 2009, offering services including charter flights and aircraft management.

As for the Chinese consortium, Yunnan Airport Group Co., Ltd. is a state-owned company that manages 15 airports, guaranteeing a total of 502,000 flights, handling 63.9 million passengers and more than 400,000 tonnes of cargo, and operates several airports in Yunnan province.

The China National Aero-Technology International Engineering Corporation (AVIC) is an aerospace, defence, engineering and infrastructure construction conglomerate affiliated to the Aviation Industry Corporation of China, Ltd.
